comments.body:
Pro tip: this is how you can avoid escaping quotes:
```suggestion
    that: >-
      "Nothing to do. All requested collections are already installed." in result.stdout
```
Yeah, that's a nice tip (you've mentioned it before). I consciously chose the one-liner.
You could also just wrap the entire line with single quotes but any of these methods are just fine.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@
- assert:
    that: "\"Nothing to do. All requested collections are already installed.\" in result.stdout"

- name: install a pre-release of the collection without --force

comments.body: Is registering `result` necessary when it's unused?
It is used in `failed_when`. I used `failed_when` to make sure setup tasks did what was expected and `assert` for things I'm testing.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +64,68 @@- name: install a dep that will need to be upgraded to be compatible with the parent
  command: ansible-galaxy collection install child_dep.child_collection:0.4.0 --no-deps {{ galaxy_verbosity }}
  register: result
  failed_when:
    - '"child_dep.child_collection:0.4.0 was installed successfully" not in result.stdout_lines'
